definition: to choose what is good and hold fast to it (idiom)

sentences.english: Obstinately he clung to his choice.
Many believe that is posturing on Buck's part but Arsenal are digging their heels in.
sentences.chinese: 很多人認爲這是在故作姿態，但阿森那還在固執着。

sentences.english: I will not be stubborn, still can deal with time.
sentences.chinese: 不會再固執的我，依舊對時間沒轍。

sentences.english: This is a reflection of Hemingways stubborn pessimism.
sentences.chinese: 這是海明威式的固執的悲觀主義情結的反映。

sentences.english: The mother was frequently noncompliant with treatment and had been hospitalized often.
sentences.chinese: 母親常常地是固執的與治療和經常住醫院。

sentences.english: A tenacious auditor might want to make an example out of you.
sentences.chinese: 某個固執的審計員說不定想拿你來殺雞儆猴。

sentences.english: From deep inside a bull- headed resolution welled up.
sentences.chinese: 一個固執的決定從內心深處湧現出來。

sentences.english: The stubborn Bull will have difficulties understanding the unpredictable side of you.
sentences.chinese: 變幻莫測的你很難被固執的牛兒理解。

sentences.english: The original clean stubborn stubborn pride had worn out by time.
sentences.chinese: 最初的乾淨倔強固執驕傲早被時間磨破。

sentences.english: I know deep feeling is hurt, but still stubborn have not changed.
sentences.chinese: 我明知深情是害，可還固執的死性不改。

sentences.english: Along with horary of push forward, he is more and more stubborn to own argumentation.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的推進，他對自己的立論越來越固執。

sentences.english: The great question ahead for Microsoft is how to engage with a participative and opinionated community like this.
sentences.chinese: 微軟首要的問題是對這類社區的干涉和固執己見。

sentences.english: The man is SO headstrong that always determines to have his own way.
sentences.chinese: 那個男人頑固任性，經常固執已見地決定自行其事。

sentences.english: You're very stu orn, but you aren't very ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 你很固執，卻沒有多大抱負。

sentences.english: The reservoir in the reserved preserve is an obstacle to the obstinate observer.
sentences.chinese: 預留保護區內的水庫對固執的觀察者是一個障礙。

sentences.english: Don't be bullheaded; see a doctor.

definition: to be strongly attached to/to be dedicated/to cling to
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
